name: V-023: Waste Collection Operations Using a POD Vehicle

competencies.name: Driver conducts daily checks listed in Defect Book in a well-lit area away from main traffic routes
Driver checks First Aid box including eye wash to ensure it is complete
Driver checks the external cleanliness of the vehicle including lights, number plates , indicators and windows
Driver checks that the cab is clean and free from unauthorised items
Any defects identified and  reported to appropriate personnel
Driver has required documentation for their load
Driver ensures that only authorised passengers ride in the vehicle and that seat belts are worn at required times
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why are unauthorised passengers not allowed to ride in the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures the safety self, the public and other road users when stopping, starting and positioning the vehicle
Driver operates vehicle safely: •following public highway traffic convention•with due consideration to others
Driver ensures that no loading takes place while the vehicle is in motion
Reversing operations are conducted safely following company procedure (or as detailed in WAP9)
Operative confirms they have been trained to operate lifting equipment on the POD
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the correct training for operating lifting equipment on a POD?

competencies.name: Operative ensures that the public are not allowed to operate any equipment on the POD
Operative ensures that the slave bins are in good working order by checking for damage to wheels, handles, lip of bin and lid
Operative does not use bins with signs of damage
Operative only uses the slave bins provided on the POD lift
Operative reports any damaged bins during the collection to the driver to assess if new bin can be provided or return to depot is necessary
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting damage to bins during collection to your supervisor?

competencies.name: Operative ensures that route risk assessments are followed when operating equipment during collection
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is a route risk assessment?
  2. How does a route risk assessment affect the way you collect waste?

competencies.name: Operative ensures that there is no overhead obstruction that the bin or lid could strike
Operative does not stand directly under the POD bin-lift when emptying the slave bin
Operative reports to the driver when bins have become detached from the lift or fall into the POD
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting detached bins to the driver?

competencies.name: Operative does not attempt to retrieve detached bins or move the vehicle
Operative manually closes POD lids that remain open after the bin has been emptied
Operative wears full waterproof clothing with the hood up, safety goggles and a face mask when washing the POD

sections.name: C - Waste Clearance from Body of Vehicle

competencies.name: Operative clears waste from body of vehicle in company depot only and when the vehicle is parked in a safe, level and well-lit place away from traffic routes
Operative clears waste from body of vehicle only after tipping to maximise amount of working space
Driver switches off engine and keeps possession of ignition keys at all times during clearance of waste from the body of the vehicle
Operative ensures access through the hatch is safe and secure and that all steps and  ladders are securely fixed
Operative clears waste using suitable tools and not by hand
Operative replaces and secures hatch cover after clearance of waste is complete
Driver ensures that other road users are taken into consideration when entering and leaving the vehicle cab
Driver parks in such a way as to minimise the risks to persons getting out of the vehicle
Driver complies with all local work instructions and specific risk assessment requirements
Driver carries out loading from both sides of the vehicle only when road and traffic conditions permit this to be done safely
Driver ensures that operatives remain vigilant when emerging from behind the vehicle and crossing roads
Driver ensures that operatives check for traffic and stand well back when offside bin-lift is in operation
Driver ensures sufficient space is left for pedestrians, wheelchairs and pushchairs to pass the vehicle without being forced onto the road  when waste is pulled out prior to collection
Driver is conscious of special care to be exercised where members of the public may be elderly, infirm, blind or partially sighted
competencies.supportingText:
1. Which members of the public are at special risk during waste collection?
  2. What precautions do you take to protect members of the public at special risk?

competencies.name: Operative ensures that small food waste containers are returned to a safe position and avoids causing a trip hazard
